docs.lead_paragraph: BARRO COLORADO ISLAND, Canal Zone The rain forests of Panama are a reservoir of malaria but no longer the kind that infects human beings, which has been largely eradicated by mosquito control. For reasons still stubbornly mysterious, the type of malaria that virtually saturates the forest infects lizards.

headline.main: Two Scientists at Field Station in Panama Study Malaria-Bearing Lizards Unharmed by Disease

docs.abstract: Article in series focuses on work of Stella Guerrero and Dr A Stanley Rand into mysteries of immunity of malaria-bearing lizards in Canal Zone (M)
